alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 4:56PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Jackson, southwestern Decatur and Seminole Counties through 530 PM EDT/430 PM CDT/... At 455 PM EDT/355 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Chattahoochee, or 16 miles south of Donalsonville, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chattahoochee, Sneads, Seminole State Park, Steam Mill, Desser, Haynes, Drakes Still, Reynoldsville, Hornsville, Fairchild and Lake Seminole. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
